alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:59PM CDT until June 24 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ARCHER...SOUTHWESTERN WICHITA...SOUTHEASTERN WILBARGER AND NORTHEASTERN BAYLOR COUNTIES... At 1059 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles north of Mankins to near Dundee to 6 miles east of Mabelle, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. The greatest hail threat exists just northwest of Kamay. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Holliday, Dundee, Mankins, Lake Kickapoo, Lake Diversion, and northeastern Lake Kemp. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
